## Survey Responses and Overall Satisfaction
```{r prep.response}
contactlist<-read_excel("/Volumes/lasellshare/Faculty_Staff_Shares$/IR/Surveys/Lasell Internal/Parent Survey/fall 2022/FY23 ALL Parents Email List.xls")
#population N: nrow(contactlist)
#sample N: nrow(parent)

#sample by status
sample.status<-parent%>%count(status)
```

```{r plot.response}
#construct a tibble
plot.response<-tibble(items=c("Complete","Partial","Not respond"),
       values=c(sample.status[sample.status$status=="Complete",]$n,
                sample.status[sample.status$status=="Partial",]$n,
                nrow(contactlist)-nrow(parent)))%>%
  mutate(prt=values/sum(values))%>%
#create a donut chart
ggplot(aes(x=2, y = values, fill=items)) + geom_bar(stat="identity") +
   xlim(0.5, 2.5)+ coord_polar(theta="y",start=0)+ #circled coord, pie centered on 2; show .5-2.5 of pie (0-.5 is the hole)
  scale_fill_manual(values = c(color_blue_lasell,"grey","#69b3e7"))+#,labels=c("..","..",..);number of colors and legend labels are based on how many groups

  annotate("text",x = 0.5, y = 0.5, fontface="bold", label = str_wrap( "19% Response Rate", width=10))+#0.5 is centered location
  annotate("text",x = 0.5, y = 0.75, hjust=2.5,fontface="bold", label = str_wrap( "81%", width=10))+#left data label
  annotate("text",x = 2, y = 0.75, hjust=1.5,fontface="bold", label = str_wrap( "15%", width=10))+#right data label
  annotate("text",x = 2, y = 0.75,hjust=0, fontface="bold", label = str_wrap( "4%", width=10))+#upperright data label
    theme_lz()+labs(title="",x="",y="",fill="",subtitle = "")+theme(legend.position = "right",legend.direction = "vertical")
```

```{r plot.satisoverall}
#lapply(parent.quan,unique)
#names(parent.quan)
plot.satisoverall<-
parent%>%#check:count(satis.overall)
  mutate(satis.overall.gp=case_when(
    satis.overall%in%c("Dissatisfied","Very dissatisfied")~"negative",
    satis.overall%in%c("Satisfied","Very satisfied")~"positive",
    satis.overall=="Neither satisfied or dissatisfied"~"neutral"))%>%
  
  count(satis.overall.gp)%>%mutate(prt=n/sum(n))%>%
  
ggplot(aes(x=2, y = prt, fill=satis.overall.gp)) + geom_bar(stat="identity") +
   xlim(0.5, 2.5)+ coord_polar(theta="y",start=0)+ #circled coord, pie centered on 2; show .5-2.5 of pie (0-.5 is the hole)
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("grey",color_yellowlight,color_blue),labels=c("Dissatisfied","Neutral","Satisfied"))+#number of colors and legend labels are based on how many groups

  annotate("text",x = 0.5, y = 0.5, fontface="bold", label = str_wrap( "Overall Satisfaction", width=10))+#0.5 is centered location
  annotate("text",x = 0.5, y = 0.75, hjust=-1.7,fontface="bold", label = str_wrap( "84%", width=10))+#right data label
  
  annotate("text",x = 2, y = 0.9, vjust=0,hjust=0.8,fontface="bold", label = str_wrap( "9%", width=10))+#left data label
  
  annotate("text",x = 2, y = 0.95,vjust=0,hjust=0.1, fontface="bold", label = str_wrap( "7%", width=10))+#upperright data label
    theme_lz()+labs(title="",x="",y="",fill="",subtitle = "")+theme(legend.position = "right",legend.direction = "vertical")
```

## Satisfaction
```{r plot.satis_aca}
#5
#"satis.overall"            "satis.aca_instruct"      "satis.aca_advise"         "satis.aca_tutor"         "satis.aca_faculty"

#since we show more than one group in bar chart, we need to set y label's order 
#the order of y lable is based on prt of the "positive" group
satis_aca.setyorder<-parent.satis%>%#check: count(satis.aca_value)
  filter(!is.na(satis.aca_value),satis.aca_value!="N/A")%>%
  mutate(satis.aca_gp=case_when(
    satis.aca_value%in%c("Satisfied","Very satisfied")~"positive",
    satis.aca_value%in%c("Dissatisfied","Very Dissatisfied")~"negative",
    satis.aca_value=="Neither satisfied or dissatisfied"~"neutral"))%>%
  
  count(satis.aca,satis.aca_gp)%>%#mutate(prt=n/sum(n))
  ungroup()%>%group_by(satis.aca)%>%mutate(prt=n/sum(n))%>%
  filter(satis.aca_gp=="positive")%>%arrange(prt)%>%mutate(yorder=factor(satis.aca))

#lapply(parent.satis,unique)#satis.aca
plot.satis_aca<-
parent.satis%>%#check: count(satis.aca_value)
  filter(!is.na(satis.aca_value),satis.aca_value!="N/A")%>%
  mutate(satis.aca_gp=case_when(
    satis.aca_value%in%c("Satisfied","Very satisfied")~"positive",
    satis.aca_value%in%c("Dissatisfied","Very Dissatisfied")~"negative",
    satis.aca_value=="Neither satisfied or dissatisfied"~"neutral"))%>%
  
  count(satis.aca,satis.aca_gp)%>%#mutate(prt=n/sum(n))
  ungroup()%>%group_by(satis.aca)%>%mutate(prt=n/sum(n))%>%

ggplot(aes(y=factor(satis.aca, levels = satis_aca.setyorder$yorder, ordered = TRUE),
           x = prt, fill=satis.aca_gp)) +  
  geom_bar(stat="identity",position = position_stack(),width = 0.9)+#,position = position_dodge(),width=0.9
   scale_fill_manual(values = c("grey",color_yellowlight,color_blue),labels=c("Dissatisfied","Neutral","Satisfied"))+#number of colors and legend labels are based on how many groups

  scale_y_discrete(labels=c(str_wrap("Tutor/other help",width = 10),
                            str_wrap("Advising quality",width = 10),
```
